titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Galispy, Indictment
CWG5406

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Washington Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against }
Henry Galispy

The Grand Jury of Washington County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Henry Galispy of the Crime of "Murder" Committed as follows The Said Henry Galispy on the 26th day of December 1864 in the County aforesaid, did willfully, feloniously and of his Malice aforethought Kill and Murder John B. Lawrence by shooting him with a pistol Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses before the Jury
Thomas Graves
Woodford Graves
Elliot Wilkerson

L. H. Noble attorney
for the Commonwealth
A Copy
Attest
James P. Barbour clk
By Wm. H. Phillips D. C.
Indictment
The Commonwealth
agt } Murder
Henry Galispy
A true Bill
A. G. Bevill
Foreman of Grand Jury
"Copy"fee for Copy 25 cts
